Articles.Content:
I'm more of a Drez guy (rez as in resolution).

I wasn't going to do this, but 5thHorseman [got it so wrong](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129292-How-do-you-pronounce-Laythe?p=2094930&viewfull=1#post2094930)... (I kid).

If we're having one of these for every planet and moon I may have to move them all to fanworks.

But I say "Dress" because why not?

I don't pretend to know the best place for these so I bow to the admins' will.

But I'd rather see a wiki update with the final word and citation so we can end this madness.
"Drez" usually.
Drez definitely.
Drehz. Although the pronunciations should be up to the player.
Dress.
Dres..
Dress.
Drez(y).
(it depend of the sol rise )
DrÃƒÂ¤ÃƒÅ¸ ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Oh no, not Dres too....

Drez

like Dez Bryant, but add an "r" noise.

Looks like I'm an outlier here, because I pronounce it "Drayce". Rhymes with "Face".

Giving away the fact that I spent about six years studying Latin with that pronunciation...

(Edit: And while we're at it, "Mun" rhymes with "Fun", "Laythe" rhymes with "bathe", and I think everything else is pronounced exactly the way it's spelled.)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-22T23:11:46Z" title="07/22/2015 11:11  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 22, 2015</time> by Landwalker**
With a silent S.

> 
> Looks like I'm an outlier here, because I pronounce it "Drayce". Rhymes with "Face".
> Giving away the fact that I spent about six years studying Latin with that pronunciation...
> 
> (Edit: And while we're at it, "Mun" rhymes with "Fun", "Laythe" rhymes with "bathe", and I think everything else is pronounced exactly the way it's spelled.)

I agree with all, except - 

Yes, "Mun" rhymes with fun, but if you look at the name, it has an umlaut U in it.

"MÃƒÂ¼n" is pronounced - "Moon".
It's pronounced "Throat Warbler Mangrove".

> 
> I agree with all, except - 
> Yes, "Mun" rhymes with fun, but if you look at the name, it has an umlaut U in it.
> 
> "MÃƒÂ¼n" is pronounced - "Moon".

I see folks on the forum write "MÃƒÂ¼n" pretty often, but I haven't ever seen it that way in the game. It's always "Mun" there. If it were "MÃƒÂ¼n", then yes, it would definitely sound like "Moon."

![screenshot10_1.png](http://i70.photobucket.com/albums/i116/landwalker/screenshot10_1.png)

> 
> I see folks on the forum write "MÃƒÂ¼n" pretty often, but I haven't ever seen it that way in the game. It's always "Mun" there. If it were "MÃƒÂ¼n", then yes, it would definitely sound like "Moon."
> [http://i70.photobucket.com/albums/i116/landwalker/screenshot10_1.png](http://i70.photobucket.com/albums/i116/landwalker/screenshot10_1.png)

Ah well, the more you know
I pronounce it Drace cause I can.

> 
> -snip-

I agree on all of the pronunciations, though I pronounce Laythe more of LAY-th. Also, I pronounce Duna DOO-nuh.

> 
> Ah well, the more you know

To be fair, the word really looks like it *wants* that umlaut. It wants it so bad.
It's Drez yo.

I pronounce it as follows:

Sad-and-lonely-little-space-potato. 

Alternatively, *Drez*.

Drez

Lay-th

Moon (I only say Mun (like fun) if I say it in a high pitched kerbal voice)

Doo-nah

And one I HAVEN'T seen brought up yet, Pol...Pohl or Pahl?

Edit: What about Tylo!!! Tee-low or Tie-Low??

Edit 2!: What bout Vall!!! Vail or Vall (Like 'fall')
